page.title: List of tallest buildings in Dubai

revisions.rev:
This '''list of tallest buildings in Dubai''' ranks skyscrapers in the city of [[Dubai]] by height. Dubai is the most populous city of the [[United Arab Emirates]]. Dubai has 63 buildings that stand taller than 200 metres (656 ft), which is more than any other city in the world, surpassing [[Hong Kong]] and [[New York City]], and 125 buildings that stand taller than 150 metres.{{cite web |title=List of Tallest Buildings in Dubai |url=http://buildingdb.ctbuh.org/?do=create&list_city=AE-DXB&list_status=CUC&search=yes |publisher=Council On Tall Buildings And Urban Habitat |accessdate=2011-02-27}} Also, Dubai has 17 highrises whose height exceed 300 metres (984 ft),which is more than any other city in the world. The tallest completed building in Dubai is the 828 metre (2,717 ft) [[Burj Khalifa]] which is officially the tallest building, freestanding structure, and man-made structure of any kind ever built on the planet. The second tallest building in Dubai is [[23 Marina]] topped out on June, 2011, and became the tallest residential building in the world surpassing the nearby [[The Marina Torch]], the third tallest skyscraper are the 77-[[storey]] twin towers [[Emirates Park Towers Hotel & Spa]], recently topped out, which rises {{convert|376|m|ft|0}} in height are currently the [[List of tallest buildings in the world|16th-tallest building]] and [[List of tallest buildings in the world|17th-tallest building]] in the world and the tallest hotels in the world, while the fifth tallest building is the 68-[[storey]] [[Almas Tower]], which rises {{convert|363|m|ft|0}} in height,{{cite web |title=Almas Tower |url=http://www.emporis.com/en/wm/bu/?id=almastower-dubai-unitedarabemirates |publisher=Emporis.com |accessdate=2007-11-12}} and which was completed in late 2009. The sixth tallest completed building in Dubai is the [[Emirates Office Tower]], which rises 54 stories and 355 metres (1,163 ft) along [[E 11 (UAE)|Sheikh Zayed Road]].{{cite web |title=Emirates Office Tower |url=http://www.emporis.com/en/wm/bu/?id=emiratesofficetower-dubai-unitedarabemirates|publisher=Emporis.com |accessdate=2007-11-12}} It is currently the [[List of tallest buildings in the world|22nd-tallest building]] in the world. Other notable Dubai skyscrapers are the [[Rose Tower]], which stands as the eighth-tallest building in the city and the second tallest hotel building in the world. [[The Marina Torch]], completed in May 2011 become the sixth-tallest building in the city and the second tallest residential building in the world surpassed by 23 Marina. while [[HHHR Tower]], [[Ocean Heights (Dubai)|Ocean Heights]] are the fourth and fifth tallest residential buildings in the world respectively.http://www.emporis.com/en/bu/sk/st/tp/ty/rs/http://www.emporis.com/application/?nav=building&id=272691&lng=3 The skyscrapers of Dubai are, for the most part, clustered in two different locations. The land along [[E 11 (UAE)|Sheikh Zayed Road]] was the first to develop, followed by the [[Dubai Marina]] neighborhood. == History == Dubai is also called 'The City of Skyscrapers'. The history of skyscrapers in Dubai began with the construction of the {{convert|149|m|ft|0|adj=on}} [[Dubai World Trade Centre]] in 1979, which is regarded to be the first skyscraper in the city. At the time of its completion, it also stood as the tallest building in the [[Middle East]]. Since 1999, and especially from 2005 onwards, Dubai had been on an extremely large skyscraper building boom, with all 28 of its buildings over {{convert|200|m|ft|0}} tall completed after 1999. Dubai currently has 527 completed highrises,{{cite web |title=High-rise Buildings of Dubai |url=http://www.emporis.com/en/wm/ci/bu/sk/?id=100485 |publisher=Emporis.com |accessdate=2008-06-07}} 314 highrises currently under construction and 461 planned highrises. == Burj Khalifa == {{main|Burj Khalifa}} The largest and most famous construction project in Dubai is the [[Burj Khalifa]], which began construction in 2004. The Burj Khalifa is now topped out and it is the tallest building, freestanding structure, and man-made structure of any kind ever built on the planet. The Burj Khalifa topped out on January 17, 2009 at {{convert|828|m|ft|0|abbr=on}} and it became the tallest free-standing structure in the world on September 12, 2007, surpassing the 553-metre (1,815 ft) [[CN Tower]] in [[Toronto]], [[Canada]].{{cite news |title=CN Tower dethroned by Dubai building |publisher=[[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation]] |date=2007-09-12 |url=http://www.cbc.ca/canada/story/2007/09/12/cntower-surpassed.html |accessdate=2007-09-13}} The building also surpassed the height of [[Taipei 101]], the second tallest building in the world, on July 21, 2007. In April 2008, Burj Khalifa became the tallest man-made structure in the world, surpassing the [[KVLY-TV mast]] in [[Blanchard, North Dakota|Blanchard]], [[North Dakota]], [[United States]]. On May 19, 2008 it surpassed the height of the now-destroyed [[Warsaw radio mast]] in [[KonstantynÃ³w (PÅock County)|KonstantynÃ³w]], [[GÄbin]], [[Poland]], becoming the tallest man-made structure in history at 649.7 metres (2,131 ft). As of 4 January 2010, the day of Burj Khalifa's official launch ceremony, the building height to top of spire is {{convert|828|m|ft|0|abbr=on}}. ==Tallest buildings== This list ranks completed and [[topping out|topped out]] Dubai skyscrapers that stand at least {{convert|180|m|ft|0}} tall, based on standard height measurement. An equal sign (=) following a rank indicates the same height between two or more buildings. The "Year" column indicates the year in which a building was completed. {|class="wikitable sortable" |- !
